parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
As far as, up to, until, during. Or achris akh'-rece; akin to akron; until or up to.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To bind, put in chains, tie together. From a derivative of desmeo; to be a binder, i.e. To enchain, to tie on.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From phulasso; a guarding or, the act, the person; figuratively, the place, the condition, or, the time, literally or figuratively.
